Bash(python -c "
from qdrant_client import QdrantClient
import os

# Try to connect to Qdrant with default settings
try:
    client = QdrantClient(host=''localhost'', port=6333)
    collections = client.get_collections()
    print(''Qdrant is running and accessible'')
    print(f''Collections: {[col.name for col in collections.collections]}'')
except Exception as e:
    print(f''Qdrant is not running or not accessible: {e}'')
")

Bash(python -c "
from qdrant_client import QdrantClient
import tempfile
import os

# Try to create a local Qdrant instance
try:
    # Create a temporary directory for local storage
    temp_dir = tempfile.mkdtemp()
    client = QdrantClient(path=temp_dir)  # This creates a local persistent instance
    print(''Successfully created local Qdrant instance'')
    print(f''Temp directory: {temp_dir}'')
    
    # Test creating a collection
    from qdrant_client.http import models
    client.create_collection(
        collection_name=''test_collection'',
        vectors_config=models.VectorParams(size=4, distance=models.Distance.COSINE)
    )
    print(''Successfully created test collection'')
except Exception as e:
    print(f''Error creating local Qdrant instance: {e}'')
")
Bash(sudo apt-get install python3-qdrant-client python3-sentence-transformers python3-pip)

Bash(python3 -c "
import json
from qdrant_client import QdrantClient
from qdrant_client.http import models
from qdrant_client.http.models import PointStruct, VectorParams, Distance
import uuid
import logging

# Set up logging
logging.basicConfig(level=logging.INFO)
logger = logging.getLogger(__name__)

# Load the textbook content
with open(''src/data/textbook_content.json'', ''r'') as f:
    contents = json.load(f)

print(f''Loaded {len(contents)} content items from textbook_content.json'')

# Initialize Qdrant client (using default local settings)
client = QdrantClient(host=''localhost'', port=6333)

collection_name = ''textbook_content''

# Check if collection exists, if not create it
try:
    collections = client.get_collections()
    collection_exists = any(col.name == collection_name for col in collections.collections)
    
    if not collection_exists:
        # Create collection with vector configuration
        # Using a simple dense vector size (we''ll use random vectors for now to test the structure)
        client.create_collection(
            collection_name=collection_name,
            vectors_config=models.VectorParams(size=1536, distance=models.Distance.COSINE)  # Using 1536 dim as placeholder
        )
        print(f''Created Qdrant collection: {collection_name}'')
    else:
        print(f''Qdrant collection {collection_name} already exists'')
        
except Exception as e:
    print(f''Error initializing Qdrant collection: {e}'')
    # Try connecting anyway in case it already exists
")

Bash(python3 -c "
import json
from qdrant_client import QdrantClient
from qdrant_client.http import models
from qdrant_client.http.models import PointStruct, VectorParams, Distance
import uuid
import logging

# Set up logging
logging.basicConfig(level=logging.INFO)
logger = logging.getLogger(__name__)

# Load the textbook content
with open(''src/data/textbook_content.json'', ''r'') as f:
    contents = json.load(f)

print(f''Loaded {len(contents)} content items from textbook_content.json'')

# Initialize Qdrant client (using default local settings)
try:
    client = QdrantClient(host=''localhost'', port=6333)
    print(''Successfully connected to Qdrant'')
except Exception as e:
    print(f''Error connecting to Qdrant: {e}'')
    # Try connecting with different settings or check if Qdrant is running
    print(''Make sure Qdrant server is running on localhost:6333'')
    exit(1)

collection_name = ''textbook_content''

# Check if collection exists, if not create it
try:
    collections = client.get_collections()
    collection_exists = any(col.name == collection_name for col in collections.collections)
    
    if not collection_exists:
        # Create collection with vector configuration
        # Using a simple dense vector size (we''ll use random vectors for now to test the structure)
        client.create_collection(
            collection_name=collection_name,
            vectors_config=models.VectorParams(size=384, distance=models.Distance.COSINE)  # all-MiniLM-L6-v2 outputs 384-dim vectors
        )
        print(f''Created Qdrant collection: {collection_name}'')
    else:
        print(f''Qdrant collection {collection_name} already exists'')
        
    print(''Qdrant setup successful'')
        
except Exception as e:
    print(f''Error initializing Qdrant collection: {e}'')
    exit(1)
")
